dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model

Class Any

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Any
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Chc, Ctr, Ref, Var

    public class Any
extends java.lang.Object
    Operations that apply to all node types.

    The Any class provides special handling for list nodes in contrast to the kind specific classes (Var,Ref, Ctr and Chc).

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.a

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
                         throws CtxtException
        Get the name of the context node.

        If the node is a variable or reference and part of a list the list name is returned instead.

        Hint: If you want to get the SHORT-NAME of a node, use DCtxt.getShortName() since it might be different from the name, e.g. when the user manually changes the SHORT-NAME via the editor or the SHORT-NAME is changed during an import
        Returns:
        The name of the context node. null if the node is not valid or has no name
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String path)
                         throws CtxtException
        Get the name of the referenced node.

        If the node is a variable or reference and part of a list the list name is returned instead.

        Hint: If you want to get the SHORT-NAME of a node, use DCtxt.getShortName() since it might be different from the name, e.g. when the user manually changes the SHORT-NAME via the editor or the SHORT-NAME is changed during an import
        Returns:
        The name of the node referenced by path. null if the node is not valid or has no name
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:

      • getKind

        public int getKind()
            throws CtxtException
        Get the kind of the context-node. This method queries ctr.isCtr(), chc.isChc(), var.isVar(), ref.isRef() methods to determine the type.
        Returns:
        The kind of the context-node: UNKNOWN|CTR|CHC|VAR|REF
        Throws:
        CtxtException - on error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
                         throws CtxtException
        Get the type string of the context-node. The type string is the string set with the type-attribute in the xdm-files. If no type is set "" is returned.
        Returns:
        The type or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - on error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getLstName

        public java.lang.String getLstName()
                            throws CtxtException
        Get the name of the list corresponding to the context node. If the context node is a list node return the name of this node. If the node is part of a list return the name of that list.

        The name of the list or null on error

        CtxtException - in case of an error

      • to

        public DCtxt to()
         throws CtxtException
        Navigates the context to corresponding a node kind. If the context-node is a list of kind the context is moved to the first list element. If the context is a kind nothing happens. In both cases the current context is returned
        Returns:
        the current context or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • to

        public DCtxt to(int idx)
         throws CtxtException
        Navigates the context to corresponding a node kind. If the context-node is a list of kind the context is moved to the named list element. If the context is a node of corresponding kind nothing happens. In both cases the current context is returned
        Parameters:
        idx - The index in the list counting from 1
        Returns:
        the current context or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • get

        public DCtxt get()
          throws CtxtException
        Get a new context to corresponding a node kind. If the context-node is a list of kind the context is created for the first list element. If the context is a node of kind a new context for the node is created.
        Returns:
        null if no node can be found
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getEntries

        public java.util.List<DCtxt> getEntries()
                                 throws CtxtException
        Fetch all referenced list items. If the context node is a list or the context node is a node in a list all list items are returned. If it is not a list item a new context to the context node is returned.
        Returns:
        All referenced nodes or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getEntries

        public java.util.List<DCtxt> getEntries(java.lang.String path)
                                 throws CtxtException
        Fetch all referenced list items. If the referenced node is a list or the referenced node is a node in a list all list items are returned. If it is not a list item a new context to the referenced node is returned.
        Returns:
        All referenced nodes or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getAll

        public java.util.List<DCtxt> getAll(IMExpr expr)
                             throws CtxtException
        Fetch all items of the corresponding type. c.any.getAll() is equivalent to c.getAll() whereas c.var.getAll() only returns variables.
        Returns:
        All referenced nodes or null on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException - in case of an error
        Since:
        2008.a

      • getLstSize

        public int getLstSize()
               throws CtxtException
        Get the number of entries in a list.
        Returns:
        The number of entries in the context node if the context node is a ListDataNode else the number of entries in its parent if it is a ListDataNode or 1 if it is no list or -1 on an error occurs
        Throws:
        CtxtException - on error
        Since:
        2008.a

        CtxtException - on error

        public boolean setImporterName(java.lang.String importerInfo)
                        throws CtxtException
        Sets name of the importer for this node (attribute IMPORTER_INFO). getImporterName() returns this name afterwards and getImporterInfo() returns IMPORTED. This only works for data-nodes
        Parameters:
        importerInfo - a String (without special signs) representing the "importer" who created/imported this node or its value
        Returns:
        false on error
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        2008.b

                               java.lang.String... data)
                        throws CtxtException

        Parameters:
        importerInfo - MANUAL_EDITED, DEFAULT_VALUE, CALCULATED, PRE_CONFIGRED, RECOMMENDED, CALCULATED_DEFAULT_VALUE
        data - optional additional data - see ImporterInfo for details. Note that additional data is only allowed for importer info type CALCULATED

        Returns:

        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        2008.b

      • setCustomAttributeData

        public boolean setCustomAttributeData(java.lang.String id,
                                      java.lang.String... values)
                               throws CtxtException
        Sets the value(s) of a custom attribute of the context node by overriding the existing values.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        values - the values to be set. Not null. Set to empty array to remove existing values.
        Returns:
        the execution result of the operation
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        22.0

      • setCustomAttributeData

        public boolean setCustomAttributeData(java.lang.String path,
                                      java.lang.String id,
                                      java.lang.String... values)
                               throws CtxtException
        Sets the value(s) of a custom attribute of the node that is pointed to by the path by overriding the existing values.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the data node
        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        values - the values to be set. Not null. Set to empty array to remove existing values.
        Returns:
        the execution result of the operation
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        22.0

      • getCustomAttributeValues

        public java.lang.String[] getCustomAttributeValues(java.lang.String id)
                                            throws CtxtException
        Gets the values of a custom attribute of the context node. It retrieves the custom attribute values from the parent nodes recursively if the context node does not have any values and if the custom attribute is registered with property inherited set to true.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        Returns:
        the values of the attribute, maybe empty. Null, if the node does not exist, or on error.
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        22.0

      • getCustomAttributeValues

        public java.lang.String[] getCustomAttributeValues(java.lang.String path,
                                                   java.lang.String id)
                                            throws CtxtException
        Gets the values of a custom attribute of the data node that is pointed to by the path. It retrieves the custom attribute values from the parent nodes recursively if the node does not have any values itself and if the custom attribute is registered with property inherited set to true.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the data node
        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        Returns:
        the values of the attribute, maybe empty. Null, if the node does not exist, or on error.
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        22.0

      • isCustomAttributeValueSet

        public boolean isCustomAttributeValueSet(java.lang.String id)
                                  throws CtxtException
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        Returns:
        whether the given attribute is actually set (i.e. w/o inheritance) at the context node. False, if the given attribute id is not registered, or the node does not exist.
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        22.0

      • isCustomAttributeValueSet

        public boolean isCustomAttributeValueSet(java.lang.String path,
                                         java.lang.String id)
                                  throws CtxtException
        Parameters:

        id - the id of the attribute (as registered in the extension point)
        Returns:
        whether the given attribute is actually set (i.e. w/o inheritance) at the data node that is pointed to by the path . False, if the given attribute id is not registered, or the node does not exist.

        CtxtException
